TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WwwAuthenticateParameters extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Parameters returned by the WWW-Authenticate header. This allows for dynamic scenarios such as Claims challenge, Continuous Access Evaluation (CAE), and Conditional Access (CA). See https://aka.ms/msal-net/wwwAuthenticate.

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("The client apps should know which App ID URI it requests scopes for.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("The client apps should know which App ID URI it requests scopes for.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Resource for which to request scopes. This is the App ID URI of the API that returned the WWW-Authenticate header.
Docs.remarks:
Clients that perform resource validation (e.g. by comparing the host part of the resource against a list of known good hosts), can still use the indexer to retrieve the raw value of the resource / scope.
If a resource is used, add "/.default" to it to transform it into a scope, e.g. "https://graph.microsoft.com/.default" is the OAuth2 scope for "https://graph.microsoft.com" resource. MSAL only works with scopes.

Public Property Scopes As IEnumerable(Of String)
member this.Scopes : seq<string> with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: [System.Obsolete("The client apps should know which scopes to request for.", true)]
[<System.Obsolete("The client apps should know which scopes to request for.", true)>]

Docs.summary: Scopes to request. If it's not provided by the web API, it's computed from the Resource.
Docs.remarks:
Clients that perform resource validation (e.g. by comparing the host part of the resource against a list of known good hosts), can still use the indexer to retrieve the raw value of the resource / scope.
If a resource is used, add "/.default" to it to transform it into a scope, e.g. "https://graph.microsoft.com/.default" is the OAuth2 scope for "https://graph.microsoft.com" resource. MSAL only works with scopes.
